services.name: Coventry Foodbank
services.description:
Coventry Foodbank @ Christian Life Ministries
To use Coventry Foodbank, you’ll need a foodbank voucher. Contact the foodbank or a local referral agency to explain your situation. If appropriate, they’ll give you a voucher.

In financial crisis? Call 0808 208 2138 (Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm) to speak confidentially with Citizens Advice. They can help with income, benefits, and may issue a voucher.

Bring your voucher to a foodbank centre to collect three days of emergency food. Volunteers are there to welcome you, discuss dietary needs, and offer further support.

services.name: Coventry City Council - Homelessness Prevention Service
services.description:
Immediate Assistance: If you are homeless and have nowhere safe to stay tonight, you can call 024 7683 4025 between 9am and 3:30pm, Monday to Friday. For out-of-hours emergencies, call 024 7683 2222.

Risk of Homelessness: If you are worried you may be at risk of losing your home, you can access help by completing an online referral.

Youth Support: If you are aged 16-24, are single or a couple without children, you can access the Housing & Homelessness service by contacting the Coventry Youth Hub at 0121 269 1940.

For more detailed information and to access the online referral form, please visit the official Coventry City Council Homelessness Prevention webpage.

services.name: Coventry City Council - Homelessness Prevention Service
services.description:
Financial difficulty and arrears
If you are having financial difficulties or are in rent arrears and are worried about becoming homeless, you can contact our Homelessness Prevention Team for housing advice and support.

Benefits
If you struggling financially, you may be able to find help and advice through our benefits webpages. You can find information about a range of benefits including Discretionary Housing Payments, Housing Benefit, Community Support Grants and Universal Credit.

Please call our team on: 024 7683 4025

services.name: Coventry City Council - Homelessness Prevention Service
services.description:
Asylum seekers, refugees and migrants
If you are an asylum seeker, refugee or migrant, you need to meet certain UK immigration criteria to access full homelessness help. 

Eligibility to access homelessness services
To access the Homelessness Prevention Service, you need to: 

Be a British or Irish citizen living in the UK or
Be from the EU or EEA and are living and working in the UK or
Have Home Office permission to stay in the UK and be allowed to claim benefits 
If you have no access to public funds then you may not be eligible for housing help from the Council. Our leaflet provides further information.

services.name: Coventry City Council - Homelessness Prevention Service
services.description:

services.name: Coventry City Council - Homelessness Prevention Service
services.description:
Leaving prison and homeless 
Coventry City Council offers housing support for individuals leaving prison. Services include assistance with maintaining tenancies during incarceration, referrals to suitable accommodation upon release, and guidance on accessing benefits such as Housing Benefit or Universal Credit. The council collaborates with resettlement services like Through the Gate, Shelter, St. Giles Trust, and Catch 22 to provide comprehensive support 
If you're on probation, your Probation Officer can offer housing advice and refer you to specialist hostels, supported housing, or private landlord 

Coventry Council's website details information about support available to prevent homelessness on leaving prison.

Please call our team on: 024 7683 4025

services.name: Age UK - Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
Age UK Coventry and Warwickshire supports older people across the region with a wide range of services that help them live independently, safely, and with dignity. Their Information and Advice team offers free, confidential guidance on benefits, housing, care options, money matters, and navigating social care. They also provide Home Support to assist with everyday tasks such as cleaning, shopping, or lawn mowing when life at home becomes harder. Alongside this, they run services that reduce loneliness and isolation through befriending, social groups, and dementia-friendly day opportunities, helping older people stay connected to their communities. 

Referrals can be made directly through their website or by calling 024 7623 1999.

services.name: Age UK - Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
Age UK Coventry & Warwickshire offer a confidential and professional counselling service for individuals age 50 and over.
Find out more on their website

Email: info@ageukcovwarks.org.uk
Telephone: 02476 231999

services.name: Age UK - Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
Age UK Coventry and Warwickshire has provided a Money Management service for over twenty years. The service enables them to support adults with managing their financial affairs when they lack capacity to do this themselves. 
Find out more on their website

services.name: Coventry Community Specialist Palliative Care Services
services.description:
If you are working or supporting someone experiencing homelessness or who are vulnerably housed in need of end of life care, an MDT meeting is held on the 4th Thursday of the month at 14.00-15.00 via Teams if you have any clients you would like to discuss. Please get in touch 

If you have any queries, would like some training for your service or you want more detail about referring people, please contact:

Email: SPCT.HomelessnessHealth@uhcw.nhs.uk
Telephone: 02476 964085

services.name: Underground Lights Community Theatre
services.description:
“I love my drama! Wednesday mornings are just for me”. Our free weekly theatre workshops at the Belgrade Theatre in Coventry are aimed at those experiencing homelessness or mental health issues

Register your interest via our website

services.name: Prospective Pathway Futures
services.description: Supported Accommodation for the vulnerable adult, male or female, aged 18 and over who must be on benefits and have a support need.

services.name: Kairos Women Working Together
services.description:
STREET OUTREACH AND DROP-IN

This is Kairos’ front-line safety service and primary referral tool for women in street-based prostitution.

A team of Kairos staff and volunteers run a street-based outreach service and drop-in sessions during the week to women working on the street. Snacks, hot drinks, needle exchange, condoms and donations of food and clothing can be accessed during this service.

The team are on hand to offer a listening ear and support and we are regularly joined by professionals including a nurse from the GP surgery the Anchor Centre, and an Independent Sexual Violence Adviser from CRASAC who can offer guided support to women who have been victims of sexual assault or violence.

services.name: Carriers of Hope Coventry CIO
services.description:
We support refugees, asylum seekers, and other migrants in Coventry. 
You can drop in on Monday mornings to speak with the Client Connection Team. They will listen to your situation, register your details safely, and connect you to services that can help. This includes benefits advice, healthcare, immigration support, ESOL classes, school and college access, and job support. No referral needed.

services.name: The Anchor Centre
services.description: The Anchor Centre offers a wide range of health services for people who are homeless or vulnerably housed in Coventry. Support includes sexual health, substance misuse, immunisations, maternity care, and learning disability services. They also treat minor injuries, infections, and long-term health issues. The team works to ensure everyone is treated with respect and dignity.

services.name: Salvation Army - Coventry
services.description:
Helping people to find work and stay in work.
The Salvation Army’s Employment Plus service offers tailored support to help people become job-ready. Our aim is to help job seekers to get a job and stay in work.

Operating at the heart of communities in more than 650 locations across the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland, we empower individuals to overcome obstacles they face professionally and personally, and to fulfil their life ambitions.

services.name: The Salvation Army - Steps
services.description: Individuals who are rough sleeping in the city of Coventry can book a shower slot for a Monday or a Thursday. There is limited availability so it important that you check with the staff at Steps about booking this service.

services.name: Authentic Centre Coventry - ACC
services.description: We assist individuals and families in securing and maintaining stable housing. Our team helps with finding accommodation, preventing homelessness, navigating housing applications, and resolving tenancy issues.

services.name: The Salvation Army - Steps
services.description: Lunch: Served to individuals experiencing homelessness including rough sleeping, sofa surfing, temporary accommodation, emergency accommodation etc from 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM.

services.name: The Salvation Army - Steps
services.description: Breakfast: Provided to rough sleepers only from 9 AM to 11 AM.

services.name: The Salvation Army - Steps
services.description:
Morning Access: Open from 9 AM to 11 AM exclusively for rough sleepers, providing breakfast and a safe space. 
General Access: From 11 AM onwards, the centre is open to anyone in need, offering a place to rest and access services.

services.name: The Salvation Army - Steps
services.description: A washing machine and tumble drying facilities are available to book by individuals sleeping rough on the streets of Coventry. They can been booked for a Tuesday or Thursday. Slots are limited so please speak to staff about uncoming availability.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - Coventry
services.description: Our Needle and Syringe Programme is available throughout our opening times. You can use this service to get free safer injecting equipment and safely dispose to old equipment.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - Coventry
services.description:
Personalised treatment plans, including harm reduction, psychosocial therapies, substitute prescribing, and access to residential detox

People are welcome to turn up at the building to register for the service and access our needle exchange programme.

CGL also have a Rough Sleepers Outreach Worker. 
Change, Grow, Live services and staff will provide wraparound support to rough sleepers and will work directly with emergency accommodation providers with the aim of moving people experiencing rough sleeping and drug or alcohol addiction into more settled lifestyles.

To refer directly into the CGL Rough Sleeper Outreach team (or if you have any queries) please send details to - coventry.roughsleeperoutreach@cgl.org.uk

services.name: Authentic Centre Coventry - ACC
services.description:
Guidance through the asylum process, offering practical help, emotional support, and pathways to integration.

We offer immigration advice and support with applications for limited or indefinite leave to remain, settlement, naturalisation, and asylum (including S95, S98, and S4 applications). We can also help you apply for passports, biometric residence permits, and travel documents. (OISC accredited organisation)

services.name: Authentic Centre Coventry - ACC
services.description: ACC provide food vouchers for low-income households to ensure access to essential resources.

services.name: Authentic Centre Coventry - ACC
services.description: We support applications for Universal Credit, PIP, ESA, JSA, Work Capability Assessments, and other financial aid programs.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description: CRMC offers free English classes (ESOL) across Coventry, Monday to Friday, for all levels and needs-including beginners, women-only, employment-focused, and IT-supported ESOL. Classes are led by experienced teachers with in-class support. Enrolment is required; visit the Centre to register your interest.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description:
The Men’s Group is a free weekly drop-in for asylum seekers, refugees, and migrants. It offers a relaxed space to socialise, play games, and build friendships. The group helps reduce isolation and build confidence through peer support, workshops, and outings. 

No referral needed - drop in Tuesdays, 1:00-4:30pm at Norton House.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description:
CRMC’s Immigration and Asylum Law Department offers confidential, specialist advice and representation for people seeking to enter or stay in the UK. Support is available on a wide range of immigration and asylum issues. Access help via the free drop-in clinic (Wednesdays, 11am-1:30pm), by emailing legalteam@covrefugee.org, or calling 02476 227 254

CRMC are also supporting Ukrainian Refugees coming to Coventry. Find out more about this offer on our website

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description:
The therapy team offers a specialist mental health service for asylum seekers, refugees and migrants in Coventry and surrounding areas.

We receive all our client referrals for counselling or art therapy from GP's and other healthcare professionals. To find out more about accessing the service, please email therapy@covrefugee.org or call our reception on 02476 227 254.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description:
The therapy team offers a specialist mental health service for asylum seekers, refugees and migrants in Coventry and surrounding areas.

We receive all our client referrals for counselling or art therapy from GP's and other healthcare professionals. To find out more about accessing the service, please email therapy@covrefugee.org or call our reception on 02476 227 254.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description:
The Advice Team offers a free and professional drop-in service to support asylum seekers, refugees, and migrants with urgent or emergency issues. This includes assistance for those facing destitution, guidance through the asylum support system, and liaison with other support agencies to ensure access to vital resources. 

We are only able to assist individuals residing in Coventry.

services.name: Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre
services.description: CRMC’s Supported Housing Team provides short-term accommodation in eight properties across Coventry for asylum seekers, refugees, and migrants at risk of homelessness. Most housing is for those with leave to remain, with some emergency spaces available. The team supports residents with complex needs, including those with no recourse to public funds, helping them plan for the future and access wider services to build independence and integrate into the community.

services.name: Meridian Practice
services.description: Meridian Practice offers specialist GP care for refugees and asylum seekers in Coventry. Patients can register for general medical support, including health checks, long-term condition management, and repeat prescriptions. The practice also provides alcohol support, helping individuals reduce or stop harmful drinking with advice and onward referrals where needed. Routine vaccinations and catch-up immunisations are available, and the practice nurse team delivers services such as blood tests, dressings, and cervical screening. All care is tailored with compassion and awareness of each patient's background and needs.

services.name: Baby Godiva
services.description: We support families with young children through a range of practical projects. Our Start Ready Project provides essential baby items like safe sleeping spaces, clothes, feeding supplies, and pushchairs for those with no means to prepare. We offer nappies, wipes, formula, and toiletries through our Clean, Dry and Fed Project, and seasonal clothing kits through our Clothing Project-including school uniforms and warm coats. Families who need stairgates can get them through our Safety Project. At Christmas, our Baby Godiva Santa Project ensures children from low-income families receive gifts during the festive season.

services.name: Baby Godiva
services.description: We support families with young children through a range of practical projects. Our Start Ready Project provides essential baby items like safe sleeping spaces, clothes, feeding supplies, and pushchairs for those with no means to prepare. We offer nappies, wipes, formula, and toiletries through our Clean, Dry and Fed Project, and seasonal clothing kits through our Clothing Project-including school uniforms and warm coats. Families who need stairgates can get them through our Safety Project. At Christmas, our Baby Godiva Santa Project ensures children from low-income families receive gifts during the festive season.

services.name: Clothing Coventry
services.description:
Do you, or someone you support, need clothes?

Clothing Coventry will help anyone in need of season appropriate clothes. You can access their support by using a rail in your local family centre, foodbank or other hub, or by requesting a clothes parcel via the following link:

www.ClothingCoventry.org/referrals

services.name: P3 - Coventry
services.description:
P3 Coventry Floating Support Service 
P3 Coventry Floating Support Service provides housing-related support for people aged 25 and over who are living in Coventry, are at risk of homelessness and have complex support needs.

We assist individuals facing challenges such as mental health issues, drug and alcohol misuse, domestic abuse, physical health concerns and mobility issues, to help them address their housing related issues and remain living independently.

Referral pathway 
You can refer yourself to this service using the form found via a link on our website or by contacting us directly during our opening hours.

services.name: P3 - Coventry
services.description:
P3 Coventry Intensive Housing Management Service 
P3 Coventry provides short-term supported accommodation for people facing homelessness with low to medium support needs. The service includes 33 rooms across 12 properties, with separate male and female housing. Support includes help with benefits, tenancy, budgeting, and moving to permanent housing, plus referrals to other services.

Who We Support
We support people aged 18 and over who are living in Coventry and experiencing or at risk of homelessness. We are not able to accept referrals for families.

How to Get Help 
You can refer yourself to our service by completing the referral form on found via a link on our website and emailing this to IHMCoventry@p3charity.org

services.name: P3 - Coventry
services.description:
P3 Coventry Family Early Intervention Service 
P3 Coventry Family Early Intervention Service provides tenancy support to families who need help keeping their home or moving from temporary housing to long-term accommodation.

We work alongside families to help them set and achieve their goals, offering support with housing challenges such as eviction risk, damp and disrepair or rent arrears.

Referral Pathway 
Self referral via the online form found via the link on our website or by calling us on 0808 196 2660 or via email 
cov@p3charity.org

services.name: British Red Cross
services.description:
If you are a refugee, asylum seeker or vulnerable migrant, we may be able to help you We offer emergency help, one-to-one support and casework, special services for children and families, and family reunions.

Call 0121 766 5444 ( Advice line opening times: Monday to Friday excluding Wednesdays, 10am-3pm)

Email RSWestMids@redcross.org.uk

For more information about the support we can off you as an seeker of asylum or refuge from another country, take a look at our website

services.name: Foodcycle West Midlands
services.description:
FoodCycle Coventry Wednesdays @ 1pm

What is a community meal? 
It’s just that - tasty food and great company!

Every week, our volunteers collect surplus food and cook it, Ready, Steady, Cook-style, into delicious three-course meals which they serve to you, our guests.
Everyone is welcome
Meals are totally free
Meals are meat and fish free making them suitable for people of all cultures/religions
You don’t need a referral or a voucher
If we have extra surplus food that week, our guests are welcome to take it home

Everyone is welcome at FoodCycle. We know that the cost of living continues to increase, so whatever your reason for needing a meal, you are welcome to join us. Some people come for the food. Some people come for the company. No matter your background, you’ll be greeted warmly by our friendly volunteers who’ll sit down together with you to enjoy a meal and a chat. We don’t ask questions and you don’t need any particular reason to come other than fancying a meal and some company.

Feel like joining us? 
FoodCycle Coventry welcomes anyone to attend as a guest and enjoy a FREE hot meal. No need to book. Just turn up on the day! 

If you need to get in touch you can email coventry@foodcycle.org.uk

services.name: Embrace Coventry
services.description:
Women can drop in or arrange an appointment for tailored support. Embrace helps those at risk of sexual exploitation, especially women selling sex on the streets.

They offer essentials, safety advice, and follow-up support including advocacy, befriending, and help attending appointments.

Follow-up support is offered through outreach connections and tailored to each woman’s needs. This can include befriending, advocacy, attending appointments, housing support, and emotional or spiritual support if wanted. Embrace works closely with other agencies, focusing on building trusted relationships.

Open to women of all faiths or none

services.name: Coventry Foodbank
services.description:
Coventry Foodbank @ Queens Road Baptist Church
To use Coventry Foodbank, you’ll need a foodbank voucher. Contact the foodbank or a local referral agency to explain your situation. If appropriate, they’ll give you a voucher.

In financial crisis? Call 0808 208 2138 (Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm) to speak confidentially with Citizens Advice. They can help with income, benefits, and may issue a voucher.

Bring your voucher to a foodbank centre to collect three days of emergency food. Volunteers are there to welcome you, discuss dietary needs, and offer further support.

services.name: Coventry Independent Advice Service
services.description: Coventry Independent Advice Service offers free, confidential support to help residents manage money, deal with debt, and access benefits. Their trained advisers can assist with budgeting, benefit entitlement checks, debt repayment plans, and challenging benefit decisions. Support is available through drop-in advice surgeries, benefit claim clinics, and digital help sessions across Coventry

services.name: Coventry Cyrenians
services.description:
Housing Support Referrals

We operate a drop in service for referral assessments between these times.

The last Assessment Interview time is 3pm and we are closed for lunch between 12:30 and 13:30.

Please note that none of our services can be accessed directly or immediately. However, when you come to us for help, we will make a decision and let you know within 3 working days.

If we have no vacancies, we’ll put you on a waiting list. When a space does become available, we offer it to the person on our list who is in most urgent need. If we can’t offer you accommodation, we’ll tell you about other people who might be able to give you the right help.

services.name: Turnaround West Midlands
services.description:
Turnaround West Midlands provide free, non-judgemental and confidential support for sex workers living and working in Coventry. 
Find out more and how to self refer via our website

services.name: Salvation Army - Coventry
services.description:
Helping people to find work and stay in work.
The Salvation Army’s Employment Plus service offers tailored support to help people become job-ready. Our aim is to help job seekers to get a job and stay in work.

Operating at the heart of communities in more than 650 locations across the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland, we empower individuals to overcome obstacles they face professionally and personally, and to fulfil their life ambitions.

services.description:

services.name: Carriers of Hope Coventry CIO
services.description:
Tuesday Community Drop In 
Drop In for tea and toast, join a warm and diverse community, connect with our partner organisations to support you and collect essential household items. 
Our drop-in is open to everyone, but is especially here for refugees, asylum seekers, and people who are new to Coventry and the UK. If you are settling into life here, need practical support, or want to meet others from different cultures, this is a place for you. For more info, visit our website here

services.name: St Basils
services.description:
St Basils Coventry Youth Hub is a Wellbeing Hub providing a single point of access to prevention services for Coventry young people aged 16-24. Services include homelessness prevention and rReferrals on to mental health/Substance abuse/primary health care/employment support services

Accessing our services
Call to book an appointment 0121 269 1940 
Make a referral for support or accommodation using this form

Anything else, please Email: supportcoventry@stbasils.org.uk.

If you are homeless today and have nowhere to stay tonight, we can arrange a same day appointment Mon-Fri, but please call first. 
Coventry City Council Emergency Duty Team (02476 832222) will continue to provide an emergency only service to those that require urgent assistance from 5pm on weekdays and throughout the weekend.

services.name: YMCA - St Margaret's
services.description: Semi-Supported self-Contained flats for Young People aged 18-25

services.name: Langar Aid House
services.description: Langar Aid House in Coventry is open to provide service users with life skills and educational skills which help them with getting their life together. For example, we are in the planning stages of offering service users the opportunity to learn new recipes using affordable ingredients enabling them to cook nutritious meals independently. Contact us for more information.

services.name: Langar Aid House
services.description: We have converted a disused allotment site into a flourishing community food growing site. The site is open for service users and volunteers to encourage them to grow their own produce and also creating a positive and homely atmosphere for them. The allotment is maintained by Langar Aid volunteers and service users. Contact us for more information.

services.name: Langar Aid House
services.description:
Langar Aid provides emergency food parcels to individuals and families experiencing food insecurity. These parcels typically include a variety of non-perishable food items such as canned goods, dried pasta, rice, cereal, and long-life milk. The goal is to provide short-term nutritional support while individuals and families work towards long-term solutions to their food insecurity. Contact us for more information. 

Please get in contact if you need to refer anyone to our emergency food bank.

services.name: Age UK - Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
More than 1 in 3 over 65’s (4.7 million people) lack the basic skills to use the internet successfully. Therefore, Age UK Coventry and Warwickshire host classes at the Gilbert Richards Centre for those wanting to better their IT skills.

Regular Computer Clubs for those looking to develop their skills and enjoy projects Tuesday (1-3), Thursday and Friday (10-12)

There is also a paid course to improve skills in using tablets and smart phones. More details about that here

services.name: Age UK - Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
The Gilbert Richards Centre in Coventry offers a welcoming space for people to learn new skills, make friends, and enjoy shared activities that support wellbeing and confidence. The centre runs a varied programme including arts and crafts, woodwork, exercise, and social groups, creating a sense of community and belonging. These activities help reduce loneliness and build stability, which are key to preventing the kind of isolation and vulnerability that can lead to housing insecurity or homelessness.

The Centre is run by volunteers and is wheelchair friendly.

We have provided some information on our [website[(https://www.ageuk.org.uk/coventryandwarwickshire/activities-and-events/the-gilbert-richards-centre/) but please do contact us for more information and costs. 
Telephone: 02476 672911 (Mon-Fri, 10am-3pm) 
Email: grc@ageukcovwarks.org.uk

services.name: Coventry Haven Womens Aid
services.description:
Coventry Women’s Aid offers specialist support for women affected by domestic abuse, sexual abuse, forced marriage, and female genital mutilation. Services include emotional support, refuge accommodation, risk and safety planning, and help navigating legal, health, and safeguarding systems. All support is free, confidential, and tailored to each woman’s needs.

Call 02476 444077 (office hours) or the SafeToTalk Helpline on 0800 111 4998 (Mon-Fri 08:30-17:30, Sat-Sun 10:00-13:00).

Call 02476 444077 (office hours) or the SafeToTalk Helpline on 0800 111 4998 (Mon-Fri 08:30-17:30, Sat-Sun 10:00-13:00).

services.name: Coventry Haven Womens Aid
services.description:
Coventry Women’s Aid offers specialist support for women affected by domestic abuse, sexual abuse, forced marriage, and female genital mutilation. Services include emotional support, refuge accommodation, risk and safety planning, and help navigating legal, health, and safeguarding systems. All support is free, confidential, and tailored to each woman’s needs.

Call 02476 444077 (office hours) or the SafeToTalk Helpline on 0800 111 4998 (Mon-Fri 08:30-17:30, Sat-Sun 10:00-13:00).

services.name: Coventry Haven Womens Aid
services.description:
Coventry Haven Women’s Aid offers comprehensive training and awareness programs for professionals and community members to deepen understanding of domestic abuse, including topics like forced marriage, honour-based abuse, and female genital mutilation (FGM). Their sessions cover recognizing signs of abuse, understanding its impact, and providing safe, sensitive support. They also offer age-appropriate education for children and young people. 

Additionally, the 'One Step Forward' course is a free, six-week online program designed for survivors, providing a safe space to explore the effects of abuse and pathways to recovery. 

Please call 02476 444 077 or email info@coventryhaven.co.uk to register for your free place on the course; please note there may be a waiting list for the course, due to how popular and effective it has been.

services.name: Coventry Asylum and Refugee Action Group [ CARAG ]
services.description: CARAG holds weekly meetings every Wednesday, 1:00-3:30pm at Coventry Peace House. These sessions offer a welcoming space to share experiences, discuss issues like housing, healthcare, and legal support, and connect over a meal. Guest speakers and organisations often attend to offer advice. New members, including asylum seekers and local residents, are always welcome. Get in touch to find out more or join a meeting.

services.name: YMCA Heart of England
services.description:
In Coventry we provide accommodation with support for young people who are homeless, or at risk of homelessness 365 days a year.

We know that people’s needs vary at different points in their lives and so everyone who lives with us is offered one to one support from a named Coach. They provide help to access local doctors and dentists, to find employment, education and training and to develop other life skills that are needed to move towards independent living.

Our services are delivered in partnership with St Basils under a subcontracting arrangement and forms part of Coventry Positive Pathway Model

Find out more about the accommodation offer and how to refer into the service on our website

services.name: YMCA Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
Youth services

Our youth services provide ongoing support and advice to young people aged 10-19. At the moment, due to the Coronavirus (Covid-19) outbreak we have had to close all of our youth clubs and pause our face to face youth work programmes. This is to ensure the safety of our staff and young people.

We are however providing remote support to any young person who needs our support and are keeping young people engaged with weekly challenges on our social media platforms, Facebook and Twitter.

Any young person needing support can email us at
youth.cw@ymcaheartofengland.org.uk. 

One of our youth workers will respond as soon as possible.

services.name: Samaritans - Coventry and District
services.description: Samaritans offer free, confidential support by phone any time of day or night, 365 days a year. You can talk about whatever’s troubling you - they won’t judge or tell you what to do. A trained volunteer will listen and give you space to share in your own way. You don’t need credit or minutes to call - 116 123

services.name: Emmaus Coventry and Warwickshire
services.description:
At Emmaus Coventry & Warwickshire, formerly homeless people and people at risk of homelessness find a place where they can enjoy companionship and support.
We offer work
All companions (people we’re supporting) work full time and there is work for everyone. Our charity shop on Red Lane in Coventry provides a commercial setting where skills can be learned in a friendly atmosphere. Companions also help to run our House Clearances by Emmaus service and collect bulky waste on behalf of Coventry City Council and North Warwickshire Borough Council. All these activities help us continue by raising vital funds.

services.name: Coventry Foodbank
services.description:
Coventry Foodbank @ Foleshill Baptist Church
To use Coventry Foodbank, you’ll need a foodbank voucher. Contact the foodbank or a local referral agency to explain your situation. If appropriate, they’ll give you a voucher.

In financial crisis? Call 0808 208 2138 (Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm) to speak confidentially with Citizens Advice. They can help with income, benefits, and may issue a voucher.

Bring your voucher to a foodbank centre to collect three days of emergency food. Volunteers are there to welcome you, discuss dietary needs, and offer further support.

services.name: Cheylesmore Food Hub
services.description:
Cheylesmore Food Hub offers affordable groceries and essentials. 
We provide a weekly food bag for just GBP 6 to residents of Cheylesmore, Whitley, Stonehouse Estate and Earlsdon.

How to apply to be a member 
Complete a form that can be found on the [website}(https://cheylesmorecentre.co.uk/ccc_services/food-hub/)

services.name: The Roma Project
services.description:
The Roma Project in Coventry holds a Drop In service for members of the Roma Community. This service is held on Tuesdays at a centre in Foleshill, which is an area of Coventry where many members of the Roma Community live. 

We can support with advice around benefits, settled status, and employment.

Proiectul Roma din Coventry organizează un serviciu Drop In pentru membrii comunității de romi. Acest serviciu este ținut marți la un centru din Foleshill, care este o zonă din Coventry în care locuiesc mulți membri ai comunității de romi.

Vă putem sprijini cu sfaturi cu privire la beneficii, statutul stabilit și angajare.

services.name: Valley House
services.description:
Valley House offers supported accommodation and floating support for pregnant young people and parents aged 16-24 with social care involvement. They provide safe housing, emotional and practical support, and help with parenting, money management, and life skills. The service includes one-to-one support, counselling, and group sessions to help young parents live independently and build stable, healthy lives.

For information on how to make a referral, give us a call 024 7663 7260

services.name: Valley House
services.description: Valley House offers short online courses through the Accelerate Project to support people facing barriers to work. Topics include budgeting, stress, emotional wellbeing, and self-awareness. These sessions help build confidence, resilience, and practical life skills, all delivered live online in a safe, supportive space.

Referral Line : 0800 328 9084 (24/7)

Email : referrals@valleyhouse.org.uk

services.name: Coventry Foodbank
services.description:
Coventry Foodbank @ Allesley Park
To use Coventry Foodbank, you’ll need a foodbank voucher. Contact the foodbank or a local referral agency to explain your situation. If appropriate, they’ll give you a voucher.

In financial crisis? Call 0808 208 2138 (Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm) to speak confidentially with Citizens Advice. They can help with income, benefits, and may issue a voucher.

Bring your voucher to a foodbank centre to collect three days of emergency food. Volunteers are there to welcome you, discuss dietary needs, and offer further support.

services.name: Coventry, Warwickshire and Worcestershire Mind
services.description:
Coventry, Warwickshire and Worcestershire Mind offers a wide range of free mental health services across Coventry. Support includes one-to-one wellbeing sessions, group workshops, and a daily drop-in hub. Specialist services are available for young people, neurodiverse individuals, and those affected by trauma, domestic abuse, or housing instability. Crisis support is provided through the Safe Haven service, open every evening. Additional programs focus on outdoor wellbeing, autism support, peer mentoring, and culturally tailored services for young Black men.

Find out more about the services offered in Coventry on the website

services.name: Groundwork West Midlands
services.description:
Our Money Mentors programme offers free ongoing support for people in Coventry and Warwickshire and Coventry who are unable or struggling to manage their money.

Every participant has access to a dedicated Money Mentor. This mentor supports them to develop a personalised action plan and provides them with intensive support to deal with debts, maximise household income, manage their household budget, make savings on bills, improve their employability and move towards seeking work, training and further education opportunities. Mentors provide advice, guidance, practical help and skills training.

The programme aims to help people increase their economic wellbeing and increase their confidence in managing their money and any debts.

services.name: Canley Community Centre ( school uniform bank )
services.description:
Canley School Uniform Bank

Canley Community Centre are pleased to offer a School Uniform Bank. 

The Uniform Bank runs each Friday during term time and offers free school uniforms from schools local to the community centre. 
Please visit the Uniform Hub Facebook Page for updates about which schools we cover.

services.name: FWT - A Centre for Women
services.description:
FWT runs four free projects to help women in Coventry move into work. We offer ESOL, confidence building, English and Maths skills, IT for employment, and practical help with CVs, online applications, and interviews. Our staff are friendly and supportive, and all sessions are women-only.

Email us direct 
employment@fwt.org.uk and we’ll be in touch or 
call Joanna (07950) 813581

services.name: FWT - A Centre for Women
services.description:
We support Refugee women & migrants by delivering a broad range of services in a women only environment, providing in-depth community participation programmes to help participants to take a more active role in the community.

This includes ESOL, social groups, confidence building, volunteering and employment support.

services.name: FWT - A Centre for Women
services.description: FWT offers free, women-only ESOL classes in Coventry, including Beginners, Entry 1, and Functional Skills. Classes support speaking, reading, and writing in a welcoming, culturally sensitive setting. They’re part of wider employment and wellbeing support. Free crèche places (ages 1-4) may be available. To register, call 024 7663 7693 or email employment@fwt.org.uk. Open Mon-Fri, 9am-3pm.

services.name: Jobchange
services.description:
The Jobchange Dudley would love to help and support you around your employment opportunities and how to improve your chances at securing a job.
In addition to a variety of training opportunities, Jobchange can help you refine your CV. 

"We will always ask about your CV first, we will guide you through the CV and help you to complete it. If you are not the best on a computer we will do it for you and suggest an IT course that will make you more independent. Creating a CV is a free service Jobchange offer."

I have a job, can I still get help 
Yes you can, as long as you are over 18 we can help you for FREE

How long will my appointment last? 
Your appointment will last 45 minutes and if you need to come back for more time we will book you in again 

Can i just walk in? 
Every Wednesday we do walk in sessions, so if you are a new customer come along to Walk In Wednesday 8:30am until 15:00pm. Or you can call and book a time that is convenient for you.

services.name: Jobchange
services.description:
Jobchange Dudley regularly hold classes and courses from which you can gain a qualification. 
Courses are free to access, with a nominal fee for the certificate at the end of the course. 
Current courses in Dudley can be found on their website here

There are also online courses you can access, these are listed also listed on the website

services.name: The What? Centre
services.description:
Counselling Services at The What? Centre
for young people aged 9-25 in the Dudley Local Authority Area or with a Dudley based GP

We offer 1 to 1 counselling for all young people aged 9 to 18 years old (or up to 25 if there is a learning difficulty) and who have a Dudley GP. Sessions run across two sites: Dudley or Stourbridge and take place between 10am to 7pm. Sessions are 50 minutes long.

We currently do also offer some counselling for young people aged between 18-25 years old, although timings for these sessions are during the day time.

Upon receiving your referral, you will be contacted within 2 weeks to come in for an initial assessment. This will allow us to allocate you to the right counsellor and to ensure that you are receiving the right support for your needs. After your assessment, you will be placed on a waiting list. The waiting list is approximately 12 weeks for non-urgent cases and will be measured from the date you were referred to the service.

If you are interested in the counselling services, please fill in our referral form and we will be in touch soon.

services.name: The What? Centre
services.description:
Fusion BAME Group
Identity and Self-acceptance 

The BAME Group can help you connect with link minded people and provide you with a supportive network, give you a space to explore the unique challenges faced by BAME people and promote your well-being. The aim of this group will be exploring identity and self-acceptance. Please register to our first group session, which will then continue weekly. 

If interested, please complete our referral form

services.name: The What? Centre
services.description:
Counselling around gender identity and sexuality at The What? Centre
The What? Centre specialises in providing a range of support for young people who would like to explore their gender identity and sexuality.

We can provide 1:1 counselling for young people aged 13-18 and we can provide counselling for their family members too.

services.name: Citizens Advice Dudley and Wolverhampton
services.description:
The Housing Advice Service provides free, specialist legal advice and representation to people facing housing issues in Dudley, Wolverhampton, and Sandwell. The team includes housing solicitors and caseworkers who support clients in court, including possession and review hearings. If you’ve received a hearing notice, a notice seeking possession, or are facing eviction, get in touch straight away. Legal Aid cases are also supported where eligible.

Phone 01902 932 170 -Monday - Friday, 9:30am - 4:30pm

Email - referral.support@dudleycabx.org

services.name: Relate Birmingham and Black Country
services.description:
Counselling Services offered in Dudley
Relationship Counselling for couples
Family Counselling
Counselling for Individuals

For further information about the above counselling services offered via our Dudley office, please visit our website https://relatebirmingham.co.uk/ 
You can also find details of whether you are eligible to be referred in for a free counselling sessions, or have the counselling sessions subsidised.

services.name: Citizens Advice Dudley and Wolverhampton
services.description: Citizens Advice Dudley and Wolverhampton offers free Level 1 immigration advice. This includes simple queries like checking if you're a British citizen or if your status allows you to work, and help with straightforward applications to stay in the UK, change visa conditions, or request an administrative review. For more complex cases, they will signpost you to a specialist, such as The Refugee and Migrant Centre (RMC) which provides free casework, advice and guidance on immigration issues for those living across the Black Country.

services.name: Citizens Advice Dudley and Wolverhampton
services.description:
If you're worried about debt or managing money, start by checking the helpful resources on the Citizens Advice Website 
 
Specialist Debt Advice Service mobile 07799 070595 text or ring and leave your name and contact number for someone to get back to you (within 48 hours)

services.name: Relate Birmingham and Black Country
services.description:
Counselling Services offered in Dudley
Relationship Counselling for couples
Family Counselling
Counselling for Individuals

For further information about the above counselling services offered via our Dudley office, please visit our website https://relatebirmingham.co.uk/ 
You can also find details of whether you are eligible to be referred in for a free counselling sessions, or have the counselling sessions subsidised.

services.name: Job Centre Plus
services.description:
Job Centre Plus provides support into employment. 
Employment related benefits such and ESA can also be applied for and dealt with in the JobCentre Plus offices. 
If you wish to use the JobCentre Plus services, you can start the process by telephoning your local office and making an appointment or popping in and talking to someone face to face. This office now offers services to a whole range of people, from the employers advertising jobs, unemployed people looking for work, part time employees looking to get more work, students and school leavers looking to enter the job market and people with special needs who need a bit more assistance in getting a job. 
Offering schemes to help people find work or develop skills, they work closely with the local communities organising work initiatives and volunteering schemes to help people gain experience in their chosen field of work.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description:
Support for women and children who have experienced rape, sexual violence, or childhood sexual abuse - whether recent or historic, and whether or not reported to police. Services include emotional support and practical help. Speak to an advisor to find out how BCWA can support you.

If you are from an agency and would like to refer someone you are working with please see our referral form.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description:
Supportive courses for women affected by domestic abuse. Programmes include The Freedom Programme (understanding abuse and building self-esteem), The Power to Change (confidence, rights, and resilience), and You and Me, Mum (supporting children after abuse). All courses are safe spaces to learn, connect, and rebuild. Open to self-referral or referral - contact to join.

idva@blackcountrywomensaid.co.uk
0121 553 0090

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description: Black Country Women’s Aid supports people affected by domestic abuse, coercive control, sexual violence, and exploitation. They offer refuge, counselling, advocacy, and help with complex needs. Support includes children’s services, therapeutic care, and help for female offenders. Services cover Dudley, Walsall, Wolverhampton, and Sandwell. Most support is by referral - call or email to find out how to get help.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description: Support for women referred by police after arrest, as a safe alternative to court. New Chance helps women address the reasons behind offending and avoid a criminal record. BCWA provides tailored support in Sandwell and Dudley. This includes one-to-one help, group sessions, and advice on housing, mental health, domestic abuse, and more. Women can also access food parcels and well-being packs. Police referral only. Referral form required.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description:
Support for women who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in the Black Country. This includes women sleeping rough, hidden homeless, in refuge or supported housing. The team helps women find and keep safe accommodation, working with local partners. You can be referred by a professional or contact the team directly by phone or email.
 
tel: 0121 5530 090 

email: willowproject@blackcountrywomensaid.co.uk

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description: Support for people at risk of forced marriage, so-called honour-based abuse, or female genital mutilation (FGM). BCWA offers emotional support, safety planning, and practical help. They can advise on rights and legal protection, and help you stay safe. These are serious crimes. If you're worried, please call or email - talking to someone can really help.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description: Support for survivors of modern slavery referred through the National Referral Mechanism (NRM). BCWA offers safe refuge for women, emotional support, trauma counselling, and help with healthcare and legal advice. They support people to rebuild confidence and plan next steps. If you think you are a victim of modern slavery, speak to the police, a support worker, or call the Modern Slavery Helpline on 08000 121 700 - they can help you access the NRM.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC supports vulnerable clients facing housing issues, homelessness, or destitution. Advisors can help you understand your housing options, apply for emergency or supported housing, and access essential items like food and funds. If you’re in urgent need, drop in to the Wolverhampton centre for advice and support.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
Welfare and Benefits advice @ RMC

RMC provides information and support in a range of languages to ensure that you get all the help that you’re entitled to. For example, welfare benefits and tax credits if you are working or unemployed, sick or disabled, a parent, a young person or an older person. RMC also helps with council tax and housing costs, national insurance, payment of benefits and problems with benefits. 

Support includes: 
Assisting with making the right application for benefits and ensuring that the
correct level of entitlements is paid to applicants. Examples, Universal Credit, Child benefits, Housing benefits, Working and child tax credits, Jobseeker’s
Allowance (JSA), Pension Credit, Income Support, Employment and Support
Allowance (ESA), Personal Independence Payment, Disability Living Allowance
for children, Attendance Allowance etc. 
Benefit eligibility advice
Energy advice- energy saving behaviors
Support to access asylum support
Government grant funding- warm home discount, Severn Trent trust fund etc
Integration loan applications

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC offers tailored support to help people achieve their personal goals through skills development, learning opportunities, and gaining experience. They can help with CVs, careers advice, digital skills, and access to education for adults and children. If you need support, you can ask for Steven at the Dudley centre or email him directly at Steven@rmcentre.org.uk for more information

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC offers free English classes for asylum seekers and people who are unemployed or not working. Classes range from conversation groups to Entry 3 level and run on a rolling basis. Staff also support learners in progressing to accredited college courses when ready. For help with joining a class, email Steven at Steven@rmcentre.org.uk

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
Refugee and Migrant Centre - Dudley 
If you need help, you can attend The RMC in Dudley where our open drop-in service runs on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday mornings between 9am-1pm. 

Regular appointments are booked on a first-come, first-served basis but emergencies are prioritised. 

Alternatively, service users can contact our new Regional Telephone Service (NOT AN ADVICE LINE) number on 0800 0663 444 for an update on existing enquiry/s

To find out about the services and other help and support available, visit the RMC website

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC provides free, regulated immigration advice and representation to migrants, asylum seekers, and refugees. Their team includes 40 OISC-accredited advisors, able to support cases up to Level 3, including representation at the First-tier and Upper Tribunal. They help people navigate complex immigration rules and secure the right to remain for themselves and their families.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC provides practical support to help clients access the healthcare they need. A health caseworker is based at each office, and in Wolverhampton, a resident community psychiatric nurse is available to support with mental health needs. Staff can help arrange GP or dentist appointments, navigate the NHS, and resolve more complex health access issues. For support, you can drop in or speak to a team member.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
Refugee and Migrant Centre - Dudley 
If you need help, you can attend The RMC in Dudley where our open drop-in service runs on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday mornings between 9am-1pm. 

Regular appointments are booked on a first-come, first-served basis but emergencies are prioritised. 

Alternatively, service users can contact our new Regional Telephone Service (NOT AN ADVICE LINE) number on 0800 0663 444 for an update on existing enquiry/s

To find out about the services and other help and support available, visit the RMC website

services.name: Groundwork West Midlands
services.description: Groundwork West Midlands delivers the Restart Scheme in partnership with Serco and the Department for Work and Pensions. This service supports people on benefits to move into long-term work. Our team works with each person to build a tailored plan. We connect participants to local employers, including well-known national brands.

services.name: Provision House
services.description:
Food Club@ Provision House

You can join our Food Club for GBP 4 per week to help supplement your weekly shop. By joining the Food Club, you also agree to receive support in the form of guidance & advice regarding your situation. 

Please contact foodclub@provisionhouse.co.uk

services.name: Provision House
services.description:
Volunteering at Provision House

At Provision House, there are many different areas you can volunteer in, which include:
Our Charity Shop
Our Food Club
Our warehouse
Transporting goods in our vans

services.name: Provision House
services.description:
Furniture Service offered at Provision House (by Referral)

Furniture - We can provide free, second hand, furniture and general household items to those experiencing hardship (delivery fee will be charged).
When in stock, we can offer small kitchen appliances (kettles, toasters & microwaves), but we are not able to supply larger ‘white goods’ (cookers, fridges or washing machines etc).

services.name: Provision House
services.description:
Training at Provision House

This is provided for unemployed adults (18+) or NEET’s (16-24). The program will give you the opportunity to gain relevant training and work experience in the areas of:
Retail and Customer Service
Warehousing and Logistics
Business and Administration

Access to this service is either through referral agencies or self-referral 

Please contact training@provisionhouse.co.uk

services.name: Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council
services.description:
Our main function is to administer applications for Housing Benefit, Council Tax Reduction and Discretionary Housing Payments.

Find out more on our website

services.name: Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council
services.description:
Find out all that Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council can offer around housing advice on their website
Housing Options
Housing advice, information and support

services.name: Cranstoun: Here4YOUth - Dudley
services.description:
Here4YOUth is here to help you learn facts about alcohol, your drinking and support with making any changes. 

When you work alongside Here4YOUth, you will have access to the following:
Information and harm reduction advice for alcohol and other drugs
Set goals to make changes if using alcohol and other drugs
Help to stop smoking (16-18 year olds)
*Attend Smashed our alcohol programme

You can make a self referral via our website or come to our walk-in on a Wednesday evening 15:00-18:30.

services.name: Cranstoun: Here4YOUth - Dudley
services.description:
At Here4YOUth we can connect you to the Brook Sexual Health Service

Here4YOUth can support you to access free condoms, pregnancy testing and Chlamydia/Gonorrhoea testing 

No appointment necessary, give us a call during opening hours, book an appointment via our website or come along during our drop in sessions.

services.name: Cranstoun: Here4YOUth - Dudley
services.description:
Cranstoun Here4YOUth in Dudley, offers a safe space for young people (aged 11-18 yrs, up to 25 with additional need or a care leaver) to talk about and receive support for alcohol and other drugs and connects to health and wellbeing interventions. We empower young people to make positive changes, to improve their well-being for a brighter, safer future

You’re welcome to come along during our open access time Wednesdays 3.00pm - 6.30pm where you can meet our friendly team.

services.name: Street League - West Midlands
services.description:
Free Employability Programme for NEET 19-30s 
Street League have recently expanded their services to the Black Country and are looking to support 19-30 year olds who are not in education, employment, or training into their next steps via a four week employability programme

What we offer:
Support with employability skills
Personalised support into an outcome
Maths and English support
Free sports sessions
Travel reimbursements
Free access to the gym and pool
Gift vouchers on sign up and completion

Street League aims to reduce unemployment in the area. 

If you have any referrals or would like to hear more about what Street League do in the Black Country, please contact: 
Claire Duncan 
Youth and Community Coach 
07887530578 
westmidlands@streetleague.co.uk

services.name: Churches Housing Association of Dudley District [ CHADD ]
services.description:
New Beginnings: Supporting Victims of Domestic Abuse @ CHADD

New Beginnings offer a wide range of support, projects and services to help those who are suffering domestic abuse (DA). These services, help support individuals to overcome domestic abuse as well as help build resilience, self confidence and a brighter future
Refuge accommodation: We offer emergency accommodation and ‘breathing space’ to help you focus on personal issues without pressure and fear. The accommodation is a secured safe haven for you and your children.
Outreach Team We have an outreach team who work with an individual to explore the tailored support required and help create a plan that ensures they and their immediate family are safe and not alone. The support offered is provided through general outreach programmes of support groups, drop-in, and one-one support and in addition through a number of specialised projects

How to contact us 
If you are suffering from domestic abuse, there is help available from people who understand what you’ve been going through and won’t judge you.
Please call 01384 864334 (24hr operated) if you require refuge accommodation
Please call 01384 864232 if you wish to speak with the outreach team.
Alternatively, you can email our team in confidence on dat@chadd.org.uk

services.name: Churches Housing Association of Dudley District [ CHADD ]
services.description:
On Route Foyer: Support for Young People @ CHADD

The Foyer works with young people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Providing a safe, stimulating and supportive environment where they have the opportunity to develop Skills 4 Life including employability skills and making new friends along the way. Young people journey towards independence is supported by their key worker who will provide guidance and support for young people to reach their goals and aspirations.

How do I apply for accommodation on the Foyer? 
Young people can visit the Council Plus, Homeless Persons section, 259 Castle St Dudley and request a referral to the Foyer or if you have a social worker, Connexions worker, college tutor or other agency worker they can support you with a referral. Many of these support agencies have the Foyer application forms or you can contact the Foyer directly for a form or down load an application from our web page.

Contact On Route Foyer 
01384 456465 (During office Hours) 01384 455464 (Out of Office Hours)
foyer.admin@chadd.org.uk

services.name: Lighthouse Community HUB
services.description:
Empowerment at Lighthouse Community Hub

Jenny is our Client Empowerment lead
Jenny is here to serve and support those in need of extra one-one time. 
It may be with housing benefits forms, job seeking, addiction rehab referral and practical support such as food parcels and food vouchers.

You can see Jenny on a Monday evening at the Lighthouse Community Hub or make an appointment by calling the Centre on:
01384239222

services.name: Lighthouse Community HUB
services.description:
Lighthouse Community HUB is open every Monday late afternoon to early evening during which there will be various activities available from Bingo to Quiz nights.

Free hot drinks and nice cakes will be available to those who come along.

services.name: Lighthouse Community HUB
services.description:
Lighthouse Community Hub is a designated Warm Welcome Space in the Dudley area.

Everyone is welcome - no referral, no judgment. You’ll find a safe, friendly place to relax, keep warm, and connect with others.

What’s available:
Free hot drinks and cakes
Warm, comfortable space
Friendly staff and volunteers offering a listening ear
Respectful, non-judgemental environment
Safeguarding and confidentiality upheld at all times

Open on Mondays from 4pm to 7pm

services.description: Shower Facilities available for the vulnerable in Dudley

services.name: Lighthouse Community HUB
services.description:
Second Hand clothing at Lighthouse Community HUB

During our Monday evening drop in, second hand clothing is available for those who are in need.

services.name: Family Hub Network - Dudley
services.description:
All Family Hub Networks in Dudley can provide Food bank vouchers for the Black Country Foodbank

Black Country Foodbank helps vulnerable individuals and families in crisis through the provision of 3 days emergency food supplies while a longer-term solution is developed.

You must have a voucher or a code to be able to receive a food parcel at the distribution centres

services.name: Foodcycle West Midlands
services.description:
FoodCycle Dudley Tuesdays @1pm

What is a community meal? 
It’s just that - tasty food and great company! 

Every week, our volunteers collect surplus food and cook it, Ready, Steady, Cook-style, into delicious three-course meals which they serve to you, our guests.
Everyone is welcome
Meals are totally free
Meals are meat and fish free making them suitable for people of all cultures/religions
You don’t need a referral or a voucher
If we have extra surplus food that week, our guests are welcome to take it home 

Everyone is welcome at FoodCycle. We know that the cost of living continues to increase, so whatever your reason for needing a meal, you are welcome to join us. Some people come for the food. Some people come for the company. No matter your background, you’ll be greeted warmly by our friendly volunteers who’ll sit down together with you to enjoy a meal and a chat. We don’t ask questions and you don’t need any particular reason to come other than fancying a meal and some company. 

Feel like joining us? 
Freecycle Dudley welcomes anyone to attend as a guest and enjoy a FREE hot meal. No need to book. Just turn up on the day

If you need to get in touch you can email dudley@foodcycle.org.uk or check out our dedicated Foodcycle Walsall and the Black Country Facebook Page

services.name: YMCA - Highland Road
services.description: Supported Housing

services.name: Champions Kitchen @ Champions Church
services.description:
Champions Kitchen at Champions Church, Dudley

Every Tuesday at 6pm, we serve meals and support those who are vulnerable.

We support the homeless, those with mental health issues, people feeling suicidal with nowhere to turn, hungry families, those who need clothing and more. We are here to support and to serve, and consider everyone who dines with us or that uses our support as our guest.

If you know someone in need, whether homeless, struck by economic difficulty, or struggling with mental health issues - please let us know by contacting us at championskitchen@championschurch.org.uk and we will do our very best to help.

services.name: Groundwork West Midlands
services.description:
Green Doctors offer free home visits to help people stay warm, save money, and reduce energy use. Our team gives advice on cutting fuel bills and making your home more efficient. We support people with health conditions, low incomes, or poor housing. We also look for issues like damp and mould that affect your wellbeing.

If you would like a visit from our Green Doctors please email 
 wmgreendoctor@groundwork.org.uk

services.name: Groundwork West Midlands
services.description:
Groundwork West Midlands delivers the Restart Scheme in partnership with Serco and the Department for Work and Pensions. This service supports people on benefits to move into long-term work. Our team works with each person to build a tailored plan. We connect participants to local employers, including well-known national brands.

Email - wmenquiries@groundwork.org.uk

services.name: Citizens Advice - Sandwell and Walsall
services.description:
The Citizens Advice service offers information and advice through face-to-face, phone and online services.

CA Tipton
Face to face advice sessions will be available Mondays and Wednesdays.

With our drop in service we aim to help you with any issues you may have, big or small. 

If you drop in to one of our offices we will make every effort to deal with your issue at the time, however some queries will require more in depth advice, and we can book you in with one of our specialist advisers. 

We will initially ask some questions to find out about your issue, so that we can work out the best way that we can help you.

All of our advisers are trained and able to deal with your queries. We are here to give people the knowledge and confidence to move forward, whatever their problem may be.

Contact Us
cradleytipton@citizensadvicesandwell-walsall.org

services.name: Family Hub Network - Dudley
services.description:
All Family Hub Networks in Dudley can provide Food bank vouchers for the Black Country Foodbank

Black Country Foodbank helps vulnerable individuals and families in crisis through the provision of 3 days emergency food supplies while a longer-term solution is developed.

You must have a voucher or a code to be able to receive a food parcel at the distribution centres

services.name: Dudley Youth Justice Service
services.description: Dudley Youth Justice Service works with children and young people who are involved in, or at risk of, offending or anti-social behaviour. The team provides tailored support to address the reasons behind their behaviour, helping them understand the consequences and make safer choices. The aim is to prevent further involvement with the justice system and support young people to build more positive futures.

services.name: Dudley Youth Justice Service
services.description: The service supports young people who have received a caution, court order, or custodial sentence. Staff work with them to reduce the risk of reoffending through structured plans, behaviour programmes, and practical help. Support may include help with education, mental health, family relationships, or substance misuse, always with a focus on rehabilitation and repairing harm caused.

services.name: Murray Hall Pantry [Your Local Pantry Network]
services.description:
Murray Hall are pleased to be host a Local Food Pantry at the Bridge to helps you stretch your budget by making sure you have affordable food each week. 

You can become a member if you:
Live within 2 miles radius of The Bridge Community Hub, St Marks Road.
Live in Tipton and use Tipton Children Centre services.
Live in Tipton and you are a Community Offer service user.
Live in Tipton and you are referred from Tipton Food Bank.

Please note you will be required to provide proof of your Tipton address

You can apply to become a member on-line or by contacting your Murray Hall staff member. 

There is a small weekly membership fee of GBP 4.50, for which you can choose a weekly shop of fresh, chilled, frozen and family-favourites to stock up your fridge and cupboard (food worth between GBP 15 - GBP 20). 

There will also be opportunities for you to volunteer to help with the food pantry. We will provide training for you to gain retail skills.

Contact us for further information

services.name: Sandwell Borough Council - Housing Support
services.description:
The Housing Solutions team offers support to those who are homeless or at risk of homelessness.

Our advice and assistance is free and confidential.

For customers who cannot access services online or via the telephone, the Local Centres are open to support customers in person:

If you find yourself with nowhere to stay outside office hours or over the weekend please contact Housing Solutions out of hours 0121 569 6883 (24 hour callback service). We can only give advice in emergencies

services.name: Brierley Hill Project
services.description:
The Brierley Hill Project is a mentoring service providing one-to-one targeted life support to help with any number of needs. 

We hold drop in sessions twice a week where anyone can meet our team and access support. We help with crisis management, emotional support, signposting advice, access to computers and food vouchers. If appropiate the team can make a referral for mentoring with one of our project workers.

services.name: Brierley Hill Project
services.description:
The Brierley Hill Project offer support on a one to one basis; we aim to walk with people over a period of time, supporting and encouraging them at a time of transition.

We have an adult service and a youth service. The adult support service is usually on a one-to-one basis as we recognise every person’s circumstances are different. We deal with a diverse range of issues such as benefits, housing, addiction, finance, health, crime and anything else that may be of concern. The youth support service has three different projects to make contact with young people in the local area; 1 to 1 mentoring, detached youth work and an open football session. We want to create a space where young people feel safe, are being supported and listened to. The football session is at The Dell Stadium, Pensnett every Friday between 5-6pm and is free. The team run detached youth work sessions in the local area every Friday evening.

services.name: Al-Anon family groups
services.description:
Al-Anon Family Groups meeting is about helping you to find solace with and support from others who have been affected by their relationship with a drinker.
Meeting day: Tuesday
Meeting time: 19:30
Accessibility: Disabled access

All those affected by someone else's drinking are welcome to all meetings (see day/times above), please just be aware that the additional meetings listed below may also be attended by professionals eg medical, educational or others interested in how Al-Anon works.

Additional meetings
Open Meetings on request

Due to the Coronavirus (Covid-19) pandemic, groups are following Government and venue guidelines and may not be meeting face to face.

Helpline is available every day of the year from 10am to 10pm. 0800 0086 811

CA Cradley Heath

If you drop in to one of our offices we will make every effort to deal with your issue at the time, however some queries will require more in depth advice, and we can book you in with one of our specialist advisers.

cradleytiption@citizensadvicesandwell-walsall.org

services.name: Samaritans - Brierley Hill
services.description:
The Samaritans are available by telephone all day, all night, any day of the year.

If you need someone to talk to, we listen. We won't judge or tell you what to do
Whatever you're going through, you can call us any time, from any phone for FREE.

Call: 116 123

This number is free to call from both landlines and mobiles, including pay-as-you-go mobiles. You do not need to have any credit or call allowance on your plan to call 116 123

What happens when you call us?
A volunteer will answer

If you phone us, we will answer with something like "Samaritans, can I help you?"
You talk, we listen

We listen to you and help you talk through your concerns, worries and troubles
We give you space to be yourself

We'll focus on your thoughts and feelings, and may ask questions to help you explore how you feel.
We won't tell you what you should do

We won't make decisions for you, our advice or opinions are not important for the call.

We offer a safe place for you to talk any time you like, in your own way - about whatever’s getting to you.

services.name: Rough Sleeper Outreach Team - Sandwell
services.description:
I am a rough sleeper, what do I do?

Complete our online form 
Email: Rough_sleepers@sandwell.gov.uk 
Telephone: 0121 368 1166 - option 2 
Out of hours: 0121 569 6883 

Severe weather 
The council initiates its severe weather emergency provision whenever the outside temperature is predicted to hit zero degrees or below. Access to this provision is co-ordinated by the council’s Housing Solutions team. 

To access severe weather emergency provision please contact the Housing Solutions team by calling 0121 368 1166 - option 2 or 0121 569 6883 outside of office hours

services.name: Top Church Training
services.description:
At Top Church Training, our specialist support workers provide 1-2-1 confidential support, crisis intervention and on-going help and advice to individuals and families with housing matters, welfare benefits, and family support. 

We can also provide specialist mentoring and coaching to help people to move on in life, aspire to achieve more, and learn some practical techniques to improve their employment prospects.

If you or someone you know could benefit from the help and support of Top Church Training, then head over to our website to complete a referral form here.

services.name: DECCA (Drug Education, Counselling and Confidential Advice)
services.description:
The DECCA (Drug Education, Counselling and Confidential Advice) Team are Sandwell’s young people's alcohol, drug and tobacco service. The team work with any young person that lives in the Sandwell area aged 18 or under and also works any agency that work with them.

DECCA provides 
Structured treatment for any young person using alcohol and/or drug(s)
Substitute Prescribing
Holistic Therapies

To make a referral to DECCA, or get some guidance if you are concerned:
Telephone: 0121 569 2201 - we can take a referral over the telephone, just ensure you have the young person permission to make the referral first
Click here to download a referral form, complete in full and then email it to: Decca_Team@sandwellchildrenstrust.org

The only thing we ask is that the person being referred is under the age of 19 and agrees to at least meet with a worker, we cannot force someone into treatment.

services.name: DECCA (Drug Education, Counselling and Confidential Advice)
services.description:
The DECCA (Drug Education, Counselling and Confidential Advice) Team are Sandwell’s young people's alcohol, drug and tobacco service. The team work with any young person that lives in the Sandwell area aged 18 or under and also works any agency that work with them.

DECCA cover everything from education in mainstream schools, to education in the community all the way to working with someone who is experiencing issues with drugs such as alcohol, cannabis, tobacco, volatile substances and class A drugs

To make a referral to DECCA, or get some guidance if you are concerned:
Telephone: 0121 569 2201 - we can take a referral over the telephone, just ensure you have the young person permission to make the referral first
Click here to download a referral form, complete in full and then email it to: Decca_Team@sandwellchildrenstrust.org

The only thing we ask is that the person being referred is under the age of 19 and agrees to at least meet with a worker, we cannot force someone into treatment.

services.name: Brierley Hill Babybank
services.description:
Brierley Hill Babybank

Many families in our community experience financial hardship as they try to adjust to having a new baby at home. The Brierley Hill Babybank was set up in February 2019 to support families with baby essentials.

We also have the ability to support some of our families on a 1-2-1 basis that are referred to us. They will be part of the sorting and making up of packs. We welcome them into our little family to gain extra support, confidence and signposting for the future.

We provide packs from 25 weeks pregnancy up to 2 years of age. Our packs include essential items relevant to age and need.

Who is eligible?

Families in need and services that are based within the DY1-10 and B63-5 area

How to refer to us

You can be referred to us through various services, including:
Family Nurse Partnership
Brierley Hill Project
Midwives & Health Visitors
NHS Directory

For details of other referral services we work with, or if you are a referral service that would like to work with us, please contact our team.
