For more information about the practical help with can offer around money management and getting support you need, please visit our website

services.name: OASIS Mental Health Support
services.description:
Contact us to book an appointment, by phone, email or our online contact form found on our website

Find out more about our counselling services here

services.name: OASIS Mental Health Support
services.description:
OASIS can provide advice and information on mental health issues including diagnoses, medication, talking treatments, coping strategies, support for carers etc

Advice can be offered to those with a diagnosed mental health problem, or to those seeking to maintain their mental wellbeing and to family, friends and carers of someone coping with mental health issues. 

Our staff aren’t qualified to make diagnoses or recommend a particular medication or treatment, but we can offer information and guidance on particular diagnoses, treatments or on what options may be open to you to help you understand or make a choice on what is being offered to you by mental health professionals in the NHS and elsewhere.

For further details of the mental health advice we can offer, please visit our website

services.name: OASIS Mental Health Support
services.description:
Social Support - Women's Group 
There is a women only session held on Friday afternoons between 11-30pm and 2pm facilitated by two female volunteers. As well as the opportunity to socialise in a safe and friendly atmosphere there is the opportunity to discuss issues that affect women. 
More Info on our website

services.name: OASIS Mental Health Support
services.description:
Social Support 
Oasis provides social support and activities including art/craft and music, LGBTQ+ support group, plus a women only session, together with access to a wide range of advice and information. 

Meals are available on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The Wednesday “Eat and Meet” is a cooked meal and on Sunday there is a Sunday dinner - roast, potatoes, and vegetables. Snack food, such as beans on toast or sandwiches, and a cooked meal are available on Saturday lunchtimes. On all meal days there are vegetarian/vegan options.

More info on our website

services.name: OASIS Mental Health Support
services.description:
Crisis Café is open every day of the week, including weekends and bank holidays, from 6pm to 11pm at our building in Faulkner Road. 
No Appointment Necessary

There are two workers available, including at least one counsellor, to provide support as well as guidance on how you can get further help including accessing services such as advocacy to help with accessing services, housing problems, benefits claims, debt and financial advice, counselling, employment support and advice plus other social and leisure activities. We can also assist in getting further help from your GP, NHS mental health services, and Social Services; and if you decide that you need emergency help, we can arrange this too

For more details, please visit our website

services.name: Al-Anon family groups
services.description:
Al-Anon Family Groups meeting is about helping you to find solace with and support from others who have been affected by their relationship with a drinker.
Currently meeting online
Meeting day: Thursday
Meeting time: 20:00
Accessibility: Disabled access

Due to the Coronavirus (Covid-19) pandemic, groups are following Government and venue guidelines and may not be meeting face to face.

Helpline is available every day of the year from 10am to 10pm. 0800 0086 811

services.name: Incredible Surplus
services.description:
Solihull

Originally established in 2014 as The Real Junk Food Project Birmingham, we intercept food and other usable materials that would otherwise go to waste from supermarkets, restaurants and other sources, and provide them to individuals and community organisations on a “Pay-As-You-Feel” basis.

We welcome anyone who wishes to purchase food from our surplus supermarket in Solihull

Food Bag Distribution
Thursdays 12-2pm at St Mary's Hobs Moat

services.name: Growbaby [Birmingham Vineyard]
services.description:
Growbaby @ Birmingham Vineyard East 

Our store rooms are open one day a week during term time, where you will be offered a hot drink, a warm welcome, and a chance to browse our clothes and equipment

Book an appointment by email: growbaby-east@birminghamvineyard.com
Or message: 07480 900 500

GrowBaby offer the following lightly used 2nd hand items:
clothes & coats ages 0-5yrs
shoes
sleeping bags
moses baskets
high chairs
baby baths
bouncy chairs
play mats
toys
weaning equipment 
breast pumps
baby sling/ carriers 
bottles
sippy cups
books 
newborn essentials - bibs, muslin cloths

And the following new items:
nappies, wipes and nappy sacks
baby bath, shampoo & moisturiser
maternity essentials - breast pads, maternity pads, cotton wool balls etc

We don't hand out car seats, cots, stair gates or formula milk.

For pushchairs we require an email referral from a support worker or health visitor to be added to our waiting list. Emails can be sent to growbaby@birminghamvineyard.com 

Families are welcome to attend a maximum of once a month for nappies and every few months for clothes and toys.

services.name: Community Essentials
services.description:
Community Essentials Foodbank 
We provide individuals and families a minimum of 3 days of meals. Our emergency food parcels are not designed to meet long-term needs. Therefore, we also try to provide additional support, such as debt advice, where possible. When available we also supply toiletries and hygiene products upon request. Please ask when collecting.

How to apply
Visit our booking form on our website and choose a day and time to suit you. Once the form on the website has been submitted, you will receive an email and text confirming we have received your request. Our team will then get to work to confirm your request to collect your food parcel at the time you chose as soon as possible. Once it has been confirmed you will receive another email and text to let you know it is confirmed, then you can come and collect your parcel at your chosen time. If there is any issues with the time you selected, our team will contact you to see if we can find an alternative suitable time. The confirmation email and text will also receive a link to Google Maps so you can find us.

Petfood Bank

No pet should have to go hungry. And no one should have to choose between feeding themselves or feeding their pets. Hard times can happen to anyone, and with pets in the family there are more bowls to fill when money is tight.

And thats why we have partnered with Pets at Home Solihull and Blue Cross to provide a Pet Food Bank to our community. Anyone struggling to feed their pets can get help from our pet food bank. We understand that coming to a food bank can be difficult. We won’t ask you for a voucher or proof of need, and our team will welcome you without judgement.

How to apply for help with pet food 
Easy, simply fill in a food parcel request form referred to above, and mention in the additional Information box on the form that you need pet food, and what you need. Because we rely on donations, we can’t guarantee we’ll have stock for all pets at all times, so it may be best to reach out to us prior to check if we have what you need

services.name: Al-Anon family groups
services.description:
Al-Anon Family Groups meeting is about helping you to find solace with and support from others who have been affected by their relationship with a drinker.
Currently meeting online
Meeting day: Wednesday
Meeting time: 20:00
Accessibility: Disabled access

All those affected by someone else's drinking are welcome to all meetings (see day/times above), please just be aware that the additional meetings listed below may also be attended by professionals eg medical, educational or others interested in how Al-Anon works.

Additional meetings
OPEN Meeting on fifth Wednesday of the month

Due to the Coronavirus (Covid-19) pandemic, groups are following Government and venue guidelines and may not be meeting face to face. 

This meeting is being held electronically on the day/time as detailed above. Please phone the Helpline for the online details.

Helpline is available every day of the year from 10am to 10pm. 0800 0086 811

services.name: Sparkhill Trussell Foodbank
services.description:
If you need help from Sparkhill Foodbank there are a few simple steps to follow.

Get a Foodbank Voucher 
If you call or email our foodbank (at any time) we can talk through your situation and put you in touch with a relevant local agency who can issue you with a voucher.

Visit the referral agency 
They will discuss your situation and supply you with a foodbank voucher where appropriate.
If you are in financial crisis and live in England or Wales, please call 0808 2082138 for free (open Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm) to talk confidentially with a trained Citizens Advice adviser. They can help address your crises and provide support to maximise your income, help you navigate the benefits system, and identify any additional grants you could be entitled to. If needed, they’ll issue you with a voucher so you can get an emergency food parcel from your local food bank.

Bring your foodbank voucher to Sparkhill Foodbank 
When you arrive, we’ll welcome you with a warm drink and our trained volunteers will chat with you about your situation. We’ll also discuss any dietary needs you may have and exchange your foodbank voucher for a parcel of three days of emergency food.

We’ll also help to support you in any other ways that we can. Most of our foodbank centres offer a cafe style environment and our aim is to provide non-judgemental support at the point of crisis.

services.name: Stop Loan Sharks
services.description:
Stop Loan Sharks - Walsall
Support for anyone affected by illegal money lending.
Access: Call 0300 555 2222 or visit www.stoploansharks.co.uk
Available: Nationwide, including Walsall

services.name: Lucy's Food Pantry
services.description:
LUCY'S FOOD PANTRY 

For only GBP 5 a week, you can get your weekly shop ranging from fresh fruit, veg, breakfast items, cupboard staples, and toiletries.

To access our pantry sign up by clicking on the Member Sign Up button and we will get in touch once we approve your application

services.name: Housing and Welfare Service - Walsall Borough Council
services.description:
Walsall Council can offer advice about all aspects of housing.
Finding a home
Bidding on social housing
Finding accommodation in the private rented sector
Buying a home
Finding a home if you are a former member of the armed forces
Finding a home after leaving an institution
Support if you are at risk of homelessness
Help finding somewhere safe to live if you have experienced domestic abuse

Before contacting the team, please check to see if they can answer your question from the online information found on their website

Walsall Council can also advise on how to save energy in your home. They can help you find funding and advice to reduce your energy bills and be more energy efficient.

services.name: Rough Sleeper Outreach Team - Walsall
services.description:
The Rough Sleeper Outreach Team work with individuals experiencing street homelessness within the Walsall area to enable them to access housing.

The team are accepting new referrals.

If you are rough sleeping or are concerned about someone who is rough sleeping, please let the team know via the Streetlink website or app.

Alternatively, this can also be done via Walsall Council 
Tel: 01922 652250
Email; rooflessreferral@walsall.gov.uk

To assist the team, if you have their name or a description and where and when you saw the person/s rough sleeping it would help especially as they may already be known to us and it would make them easier to find.

services.name: Job Centre Plus
services.description:
Job Centre Plus provides support into employment. 
Employment related benefits such and ESA can also be applied for and dealt with in the JobCentre Plus offices. 
If you wish to use the JobCentre Plus services, you can start the process by telephoning your local office and making an appointment or popping in and talking to someone face to face. This office now offers services to a whole range of people, from the employers advertising jobs, unemployed people looking for work, part time employees looking to get more work, students and school leavers looking to enter the job market and people with special needs who need a bit more assistance in getting a job. 
Offering schemes to help people find work or develop skills, they work closely with the local communities organising work initiatives and volunteering schemes to help people gain experience in their chosen field of work.

services.name: Kaushalya UK
services.description:
"Let's Talk Happiness" - a group run by Kaushalya UK

This group runs every 1st and 3rd Monday of the month at the Bus Station in Walsall. 
The aim is to provide a safe space for women to meet together and grow together in good health and wellbeing. 

We invite an expert to join us each session to talk about something or lead us in an activity that promotes good mental, physical and emotional health.

services.name: Job Centre Plus
services.description:
Job Centre Plus provides support into employment. 
Employment related benefits such and ESA can also be applied for and dealt with in the JobCentre Plus offices. 
If you wish to use the JobCentre Plus services, you can start the process by telephoning your local office and making an appointment or popping in and talking to someone face to face. This office now offers services to a whole range of people, from the employers advertising jobs, unemployed people looking for work, part time employees looking to get more work, students and school leavers looking to enter the job market and people with special needs who need a bit more assistance in getting a job.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC provides advice in multiple languages to help people understand what financial support they’re entitled to. Whether you're working, unemployed, disabled, a parent, or an older person, RMC can support you in applying for the right benefits, accessing grants, and dealing with benefit-related issues.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
The Refugee & Migrant Centre’s Boosting Advice Project supports refugees and migrants aged 65 and over living in Wolverhampton and Walsall to maximise their income and live independently. 

The team provides free, regulated immigration advice, help with benefit checks and applications, access to emergency grants, and practical cost-saving guidance such as energy advice, NHS cost-reduction schemes, and travel concessions. 

Support is available in over 50 languages, ensuring everyone can receive clear, trusted advice. 

Drop-in sessions run Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday from 9 am-1 pm at RMC’s Wolverhampton and Walsall offices.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC provides free, regulated immigration advice and representation to migrants, asylum seekers, and refugees. Their team includes 40 OISC-accredited advisors, able to support cases up to Level 3, including representation at the First-tier and Upper Tribunal. They help people navigate complex immigration rules and secure the right to remain for themselves and their families.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC provides practical support to help clients access the healthcare they need. A health caseworker is based at each office, and in Wolverhampton, a resident community psychiatric nurse is available to support with mental health needs. Staff can help arrange GP or dentist appointments, navigate the NHS, and resolve more complex health access issues. For support, you can drop in or speak to a team member.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC supports vulnerable clients facing housing issues, homelessness, or destitution. Advisors can help you understand your housing options, apply for emergency or supported housing, and access essential items like food and funds. If you’re in urgent need, drop in to the Wolverhampton centre for advice and support.

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC offers tailored support to help people achieve their personal goals through skills development, learning opportunities, and gaining experience. They can help with CVs, careers advice, digital skills, and access to education for adults and children. If you need support, you can ask for Mark at the Walsall centre or email him directly at mark@rmcentre.org.uk

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
he Refugee and Migrant Centre (RMC) offers free, confidential support to asylum seekers, refugees, and migrants. You can attend their open drop-in service on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday mornings between 9am-1pm. Appointments are given on a first-come, first-served basis, but emergencies are prioritised.

Or phone 0800 0663 444

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description:
he Refugee and Migrant Centre (RMC) offers free, confidential support to asylum seekers, refugees, and migrants. You can attend their open drop-in service on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday mornings between 9am-1pm. Appointments are given on a first-come, first-served basis, but emergencies are prioritised.

Or phone 0800 0663 444

services.name: The Refugee and Migrant Centre West Midlands [RMC]
services.description: RMC offers free English classes for asylum seekers and people who are unemployed or not working. Classes range from conversation groups to Entry 3 level and run on a rolling basis. Staff also support learners in progressing to accredited college courses when ready. For help with joining a class, email Steven at Steven@rmcentre.org.uk

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - The Beacon
services.description:
Our service is open to adults and young people aged 10 - 19 who are looking to make changes around drinking or drugs.

You don't need to book an appointment, just turn up. Feel free to bring someone with you for support.

Everyone is welcome and you'll meet lots of people who are in the same situation as you. 

A friendly member of staff will be there to greet you when you walk in.

You don't need to bring anything with you.

We are a 2 minute walk from Walsall train station. Exit at the side entrance and our building is to the left-hand side. There is also limited parking available if you are coming by car.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - The Beacon
services.description:
The Quadrant

Our service is open to adults and young people aged 10 - 19 who are looking to make changes around drinking or drugs.

CGL The Beacon offer a postal needle exchange service. 

You can order free injecting equipment for home delivery using a service called NSPdirect. 

Get in touch if you'd like to find out more.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - The Beacon
services.description:
CGL The Beacon provides medically-assisted recovery including medical detoxification and alternative medication to reduce people's use of some illegal drugs.

Our service is open to adults and young people aged 10 - 19 who are looking to make changes around drinking or drugs.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - The Beacon
services.description:
CGL The Beacon offers it's services to adults and young people aged 10-19 who are looking to make changes around drinking or drugs. 

We hold health care clinics at which our well-being nurses provide health care advice, screening, and vaccinations for blood borne viruses, such as Hepatitis C.

services.name: Change Grow Live [CGL] - The Beacon
services.description:
The Beacon offers an Individual Placement and Support (IPS) programme for adults (18+) who are in structured treatment and interested in paid work. You’ll get a dedicated Employment Specialist who helps with everything from identifying what kind of job you’d like, to writing your CV, applying, interviewing, and staying in work. Support lasts for up to nine months while finding a job, plus up to four months after you’ve started, to help with settling in. They also help you understand how work might affect your benefits, and work with your treatment plan so you can maintain paid work during recovery.

Find out more information on the CGL website

services.name: Micro Rainbow
services.description:
Why we run safe houses dedicated solely to LGBTQI asylum seekers and refugees

In 76 countries homosexuality is illegal. 1,500 LGBTQI refugees from those countries come to the UK every year.

When they come to the UK they are still not safe. Because of their sexuality, gender identity, gender expression or intersex status they often:
are abused in refugee accommodation by other refugees who often come from the same countries they are escaping from
become homeless and depressed
are rejected by their ethnic community and live in poverty

What we are doing to help LGBTQI asylum seekers and refugees

Micro Rainbow opened the first safe house in the United Kingdom dedicated solely to LGBTQI asylum seekers and refugees. Our houses provide a safe and temporary shelter for all LGBTQI asylum seekers and refugees. They are located in the London area, in the North West and in the West Midlands.

If you need a translator, please email housing@microrainbow.org to arrange this in advance.
Our support line number is 0800 3585851. This number is free to call Mon-Fri 2pm-5pm. Our support line is for urgent matters

services.name: Humanity First UK Walsall foodbank
services.description:
The Walsall Food bank run by Humanity First UK opened in the summer of 2021 and has been providing emergency food and support to people locked in poverty in the town.
They are open Mon-Fri in the Saddlers Centre, Walsall.
Walsall Foodbank operate an open referral policy, taking in referrals through Walsall Council, but also welcoming in people who walk through the doors needing help.

The foodbank offers the basic essentials needed to feed a family and is staffed by volunteers, with support from Walsall Council and other stakeholders.

services.name: Citizens Advice - Sandwell and Walsall
services.description:
The Citizens Advice service offers information and advice through face-to-face, phone and online services.

CA Walsall
Face to face advice sessions are available every Tuesday from 9am - 3:30pm

With our drop in service we aim to help you with any issues you may have, big or small. 

If you drop in to one of our offices we will make every effort to deal with your issue at the time, however some queries will require more in depth advice, and we can book you in with one of our specialist advisers. 

We will initially ask some questions to find out about your issue, so that we can work out the best way that we can help you.

All of our advisers are trained and able to deal with your queries. We are here to give people the knowledge and confidence to move forward, whatever their problem may be.

Contact Us
office@citizensadvicesandwell-walsall.org
Adviceline on 0300 330 9017.

services.name: Black Country Womens Aid
services.description:
Support for women who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in the Black Country. This includes women sleeping rough, hidden homeless, in refuge or supported housing. The team helps women find and keep safe accommodation, working with local partners. You can be referred by a professional or contact the team directly by phone or email.
 
tel: 0121 5530 090 

email: willowproject@blackcountrywomensaid.co.uk

services.name: Ablewell Advice
services.description:
We are a distribution centre for the Black County Food Bank, enabling us to offer support to local people who are experiencing temporary difficulties. In 2019, the Black County Food Bank network helped over 16,000 people in need in the local area. In 2019, our food bank assisted 3361 customers. 
Reasons that people may need to access our Food Bank include: benefit delays, sanctions, temporary reductions in income, debts or setting up home after a period of homelessness.

To receive help from the Food Bank, you will need to obtain a Food Bank voucher

services.name: Ablewell Advice
services.description:
We offer free, independent, and confidential advice on debt and welfare benefits. Depending on availability, we can also represent you in court or at a tribunal.

Our advisers can help with a wide range of issues, including housing, employment, and consumer rights, and we’ll always point you in the right direction if it’s something outside our area.

Here are just a few of the ways we support people:
Making sure you’re getting all the income you’re entitled to
Filling in benefit forms
Creating budgets that work for you
Contacting creditors and setting up repayment plans
Helping you apply for bankruptcy or a Debt Relief Order
Appealing benefit decisions or raising complaints with ombudsman services
Going to court with you if you’re facing rent or mortgage arrears
Representing you at social security tribunals

Referrals are through the NHS, via a health professional. We are currently not taking on new referrals due to oversubscription for our service

You can call our team on 01922 669840 or contact Alex, our Young Person's Team Leader at  07827 872091. You can also email thebeaconyp@cgl.org.uk if you need any help or support.

services.name: Samaritans - Walsall and District
services.description:
The Samaritans are available by telephone all day, all night, any day of the year.

If you need someone to talk to, we listen. We won't judge or tell you what to do
Whatever you're going through, you can call us any time, from any phone for FREE.

Call: 116 123

This number is free to call from both landlines and mobiles, including pay-as-you-go mobiles. You do not need to have any credit or call allowance on your plan to call 116 123

What happens when you call us?
A volunteer will answer

If you phone us, we will answer with something like "Samaritans, can I help you?"
You talk, we listen

We listen to you and help you talk through your concerns, worries and troubles
We give you space to be yourself

We'll focus on your thoughts and feelings, and may ask questions to help you explore how you feel.
We won't tell you what you should do

We won't make decisions for you, our advice or opinions are not important for the call.

We offer a safe place for you to talk any time you like, in your own way - about whatever’s getting to you.

services.name: Kaushalya UK
services.description:
Kaushalya UK are here to help victims of domestic abuse, honour-based abuse and forced marriage. If you are seeking a safe space in community or support in your own home, we can help.

We offer:
Confidential, empathetic, and non-judgmental person-centred emotional support to victims of domestic and sexual abuse.
Access to information to help you understand your rights and make informed decisions.
Support to access legal support.
Support to identify and reduce risks and develop safety planning accordingly.
Support to apply welfare benefit, help with money matters and employability.
Specialist counselling services for you and your children.
Help to make informed decisions.
Support to access temporary accommodation.

Please contact us via our website if you need help and support.

services.description:
Purpose built to provide training and services for the local community, The Small Street Centre has two training rooms and one ICT Suites available for hire as well as office space for other not for profit organisations.

The centre offers free internet access and printing services to the general public and training for job seekers, as well as a weekly job club and advice and guidance through our Learning and Skills department.

services.name: Jobchange
services.description:
The Jobchange Walsall would love to help and support you around your employment opportunities and how to improve your chances at securing a job.
In addition to a variety of training opportunities, Jobchange can help you refine your CV. 

"We will always ask about your CV first, we will guide you through the CV and help you to complete it. If you are not the best on a computer we will do it for you and suggest an IT course that will make you more independent. Creating a CV is a free service Jobchange offer."

I have a job, can I still get help 
Yes you can, as long as you are over 18 we can help you for FREE

How long will my appointment last? 
Your appointment will last 45 minutes and if you need to come back for more time we will book you in again 

Can i just walk in? 
Every Wednesday we do walk in sessions, so if you are a new customer come along to Walk In Wednesday 8:30am until 15:00pm. Or you can call and book a time that is convenient for you.

services.name: UK Mens Sheds Association
services.description:
Caldmore Community’s Gardens’ Men’s Shed project aims to create a regular meeting space for men in the environs of Caldmore Community Garden in Walsall, where they can develop ideas and collaborative projects through regular meetings and activity sessions.

As a group we have been meeting since October 2016 and already we have built a shed and have kitted it out with a wood burning stove, lighting and other improvements to make it a place to work and socialise together. We have adopted a raised growing bed in Caldmore Community Garden which we have been cultivating for a while. We have also worked together to construct a wood burning stove, built a tree house, added a playhouse to our children playground and are now learning how to build wooden planters to raise some funds for future projects.

Along the way we have a lot of fun and drink loads of coffee and tea. Every session starts with coffee and croissants!

Caldmore Men’s Shed is for you!
We are an easy-going group who always welcome new people. You don’t have to have any previous experience of doing anything practical or of getting involved in groups. When we take on projects we plan and do them together learning from each other. Most importantly it’s free to join! All we ask is that you come and give up a little of your time and get involved. Its open to men of all ages, cultures and backgrounds.

We meet every Monday between 10.00 am and 12.30 pm. Every session starts with a sit down and a cup of coffee while they plan their morning together.

Contact: Stephen Breeze for more information

T: 07970 856148 / E: caldmoregarden@gmail.com

services.name: POhWER Advocacy Charity
services.description:
POhWER Advocacy provide services in five local authorities in the West Midlands helping people who need to get their voices heard.

In Walsall, POhWER provides advocacy services to those who are affected by mental health issues or those who lack capacity in making important decisions. In addition POhWER also provides NHS Complaints Advocacy for people who wish to make a complaint about treatment provided under the NHS.

To make a referral to the advocacy services in Walsall, you can download the forms from our website

Click here to visit POhWER West Midlands Facebook Page

services.name: Nash Dom CIC
services.description:
Carpathian Community Shop is a community-focused, not-for-profit shop based at Walsall Cultural Centre, created to support local residents facing food insecurity while strengthening community connection. The shop offers access to affordable, good-quality food and everyday essentials, helping people manage rising living costs with dignity and choice.

Alongside tackling food poverty, Carpathian Community Shop promotes sustainability by reducing food waste and working with local partners. It is a welcoming, inclusive space rooted in community support, volunteering, and social value, designed to respond to local need while building resilience within the neighbourhood.

services.name: Nash Dom CIC
services.description:
Nash Dom Advice Centre
We provide independent, confidential and impartial advice on your rights and responsibilities. The centre benefits individuals and families who have newly arrived to West Midlands.

We are a multilingual advice centre aimed for communities who do not speak or have very poor English language skills. 

For time being we provide advice in Polish, Slovak, Czech, Moldovan, Romanian, Bulgarian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Estonian, Georgian, Russian, Belorussian, Ukrainian and English languages. In the near future we hope to expand our available languages.

Do you need help with?
Homelessness
Housing
Welfare Benefits
Debt Management
Immigration Law
Education
Health
Employment Law
Jobs and Career Advice

services.name: Bloxwich and Blakenall Foodbank
services.description:
If you need help from Bloxwich and Blakenall Foodbank there are a few simple steps to follow.
Get a Foodbank Voucher If you call or email our foodbank (at any time) we can talk through your situation and put you in touch with a relevant local agency who can issue you with a voucher.
Visit the referral agency They will discuss your situation and supply you with a foodbank voucher where appropriate.

If you are in financial crisis and live in England or Wales, please call 0808 2082138 for free (open Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm) to talk confidentially with a trained Citizens Advice adviser. They can help address your crises and provide support to maximise your income, help you navigate the benefits system, and identify any additional grants you could be entitled to. If needed, they’ll issue you with a voucher so you can get an emergency food parcel from your local food bank.
Bring your foodbank voucher to Bloxwich and Blakenall Foodbank When you arrive, we’ll welcome you and our trained volunteers will discuss any dietary needs you may have and exchange your foodbank voucher for a parcel of three days of emergency food.

services.name: Open Heaven Pantry Wednesbury [Your Local Pantry Network]
services.description:
For a small weekly subscription of GBP 5.50, members at the Open Heaven Pantry will be able to purchase a weekly food shop including fresh fruit and vegetables and family favourites to stock up the cupboard and fridge.

Each member is allocated a slot to come to the pantry to select their food.

Please can all new members apply to join via the Your Local Pantry Website. please note that there is currently a waiting list due to high demand for this service

services.name: Rethink Mental Illness
services.description:
The Sanctuary Community Mental Health Service, provides goal based support for people aged 17+ in Walsall to manage their mental health.

We offer
One-to-One targeted support
SafeSpace Sessions
Coffee & Cope Groups
Perinatal Support
Signposting Information
Peer Support Groups
Tailored Workshops
Volunteering/Peer Support Opportunities.

If you want to receive support from the service then you can either self refer or be referred by another professional or a family member or friend.

If you want refer please contact us by calling 01922 494 479 or email us at enablement@rethink.org 
 
The Sanctuary Hub as its own Facebook Page, so give us a follow to keep up with all our news and activites.

services.name: Citizens Advice - Sandwell and Walsall
services.description:
CASSIE (Citizens Advice Supporting Social Inclusion and Equality) is a van that transforms into a fully accessible mobile office, allowing Citizens Advice workers to meet people at community locations across the six towns of Sandwell.

CASPER (Citizens Advice Supporting People's Economic Recovery) is a van that transforms into a fully accessible mobile office, allowing Citizens Advice workers to meet people at community locations across Walsall

services.name: Tots In Need CIC
services.description:
Tots in Need was launched during the Covid lockdown in February 2021, after seeing a need for a baby bank in Walsall, West Midlands.

The Community Interest Company works on a referral basis from midwives and health visitors.

Baby clothes, nappies, prams and other essential items are provided to expectant mothers and babies where poverty is being experienced. 

In order to access this service, beneficiaries need to be referred in by a professional such as a midwife, social worker, etc. It is not possible to self refer into this service.

services.name: Sandwell Borough Council - Housing Support
services.description:
The Housing Solutions team offers support to those who are homeless or at risk of homelessness.

Our advice and assistance is free and confidential.

For customers who cannot access services online or via the telephone, the Local Centres are open to support customers in person:

If you find yourself with nowhere to stay outside office hours or over the weekend please contact Housing Solutions out of hours 0121 569 6883 (24 hour callback service). We can only give advice in emergencies

services.name: Walsall North Trussell Foodbank
services.description:
If you need help from Walsall North Foodbank there are a few simple steps to follow.
Get a Foodbank Voucher If you call or email our foodbank (at any time) we can talk through your situation and put you in touch with a relevant local agency who can issue you with a voucher.
Visit the referral agency They will discuss your situation and supply you with a foodbank voucher where appropriate.

If you are in financial crisis and live in England or Wales, please call 0808 2082138 for free (open Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm) to talk confidentially with a trained Citizens Advice adviser. They can help address your crises and provide support to maximise your income, help you navigate the benefits system, and identify any additional grants you could be entitled to. If needed, they’ll issue you with a voucher so you can get an emergency food parcel from your local food bank.
Bring your foodbank voucher to Walsall North Foodbank When you arrive, we’ll welcome you with a warm drink and our trained volunteers will chat with you about your situation. We’ll also discuss any dietary needs you may have and exchange your foodbank voucher for a parcel of three days of emergency food. We’ll also help to support you in any other ways that we can. Most of our foodbank centres offer a cafe style environment and our aim is to provide non-judgemental support at the point of crisis.
